summary: I have always felt the servants in Skyrim should wear the livery of the houses they serve. This mod adds unique servant livery to the Stewards of each hold.
descriptionHtml:
I have always felt the servants in Skyrim should wear the livery of the houses they serve.

I’ve given the Steward of each hold a stand alone outfit in the colours of their Jarl. The holds crest is displayed on the hem of the tunic. The stewards uniforms are not available to purchase or craft, but if you should get your hands on one it will fit any gender character and work with any body mod you have installed.

Resolution is 1024x because I’d much rather have twice as many outfits in a cell than twice as many pixels on one outfit. I've compressed it to DXT1 so it shouldn't cause any kind of performance hit.

The mod requires the Unofficial Skyrim Patch because otherwise I would have needed to create a patch for this absurdly tiny mod to reinstate some of the USKP fixes. I'd rather not clutter people's load orders that way. If you don't use the USKP you should probably download it. Its pretty great.

The textures are recolours by me of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/5603/?]Kobayashi’s 2X Clothing Remix[/url]  with hold crests pulled off the same modders  [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3067/?]HD Banners[/url]. It will look better alongside their clothing retextures, so I heartily recommend them.

[b]Other notes:[/b]
I've also uploaded a patch for those who use Inhabitants of Skyrim. It makes Stewards Uniforms compatible with Inhabitants of Skyrim Version 3 (The one with vanilla hair). As a bonus, it also makes Inhabitants of Skyrim fully compatible with the Unofficial Skyrim Patch.

[b][size=3]To Do:[/size][/b]
- Make Steward Uniforms available to Hearthfire homestead Stewards.

- Add functionality similar to Appropriately Attired Jarls so that Stewards change outfits when their status changes during the Civil War quest line.

- Possibly change the trim colour on Falkreath, Whiterun and Riften Stewards Uniforms

[b][size=3]Eventually:
[/size][/b]
 - Expand Servant Livery to all servant characters, including those added by Inconsequential NPC’s.

[b][size=2]Other Mods by me:[/size][/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52436/?]Mine Foreman Sell Ore[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51566/?]Servants in Livery: Stewards Uniforms
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52878/?]Cultural Armors - The Khajiit[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51886/?]USKP Patch for TK Children[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51860/?]Freckle Face for TK Children[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52671/?]Detailed TreeLOD for Realistic Aspens
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58622/?]Hi Res East Empire Trading Company Sign[/url]
author: Kidhedera

files.name: Servants in Livery - Steward Uniforms
files.changelogHtml:
26/03/14 - Silent update to the Inhabitants of Skyrim Patch.
The only change was that I reordered the masters and synchronised to USKP updates that I missed.
7/03/14 - Syncronised with USKP
An update snuck past me, but now it should be up to date with the latest USKP.
